summary: Joint Professional Military Education programs bring together officers from across the military and prepare them to work together in complex operations and major conflicts. However, according to one DOD document, these programs have “stagnated” into a credit-earning exercise. We found the programs met accreditation standards. However, they did not always include the required mix of students. For example, an Air Force program lacked Navy/Marine Corps/Coast...
title: Professional Military Education: Programs Are Accredited, but Additional Information is Needed to Assess Effectiveness
